concept.title: Rounds, Turns, and Actions
concept.shortdesc: This is a discussion on what Rounds, Turns, and Actions are.

conbody.p: Combat occurs in rounds, each one taking approximately 10 seconds of game-time. Each round, every character gets a turn within the round, where they take actions. Actions are things that the characters can do. Every character gets to do a number of actions that are equal to their Speed. Actions include things such as running, attacking, or using abilities.

Each round represents about 30 seconds of time in game, though that can be changed according to the GMâ€™s wishes. This is important to understand the length of effects, and the logical limits to what can be completed within a round.
